segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 6
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 6

segments.pli: 6. Mahāvagga
segments.en: 6. The Great Chapter

segments.pli: 56. Phaggunasutta
segments.en: 56. With Phagguṇa

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā phagguno ābādhiko hoti dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
segments.en: Now at that time Venerable Phagguṇa was sick, suffering, gravely ill.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “āyasmā, bhante, phagguno ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
segments.en: “Sir, Venerable Phagguṇa is sick.

segments.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā yenāyasmā phagguno tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā”ti.
segments.en: Sir, please go to Venerable Phagguṇa out of compassion.”

segments.pli: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
segments.en: The Buddha consented in silence.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā phagguno tenupasaṅkami.
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat and went to Venerable Phagguṇa.

segments.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā phagguno bhagavantaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.
segments.en: Venerable Phagguṇa saw the Buddha coming off in the distance

segments.pli: Disvāna mañcake samadhosi.
segments.en: and tried to rise on his cot.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ phaggunaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said to him,

segments.pli: “alaṃ, phagguna, mā tvaṃ mañcake samadhosi.
segments.en: “It’s all right, Phagguṇa, don’t get up.

segments.pli: Santimāni āsanāni parehi paññattāni, tatthāhaṃ nisīdissāmī”ti.
segments.en: There are some seats spread out by others, I will sit there.”

segments.pli: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane.
segments.en: He sat on the seat spread out

segments.pli: Nisajja kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ phaggunaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: and said to Venerable Phagguṇa:

segments.pli: “Kacci te, phagguna, khamanīyaṃ kacci yāpanīyaṃ? Kacci te dukkhā vedanā paṭikkamanti, no abhikkamanti; paṭikkamosānaṃ paññāyati, no abhikkamo”ti?
segments.en: “Phagguṇa, I hope you’re keeping well; I hope you’re alright. And I hope the pain is fading, not growing, that its fading is evident, not its growing.”

segments.pli: “Na me, bhante, khamanīyaṃ na yāpanīyaṃ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṃ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.
segments.en: “Sir, I’m not keeping well, I’m not alright. The pain is terrible and growing, not fading; its growing is evident, not its fading.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, balavā puriso tiṇhena sikharena muddhani abhimattheyya; evamevaṃ kho me, bhante, adhimattā vātā muddhani ūhananti.
segments.en: The winds piercing my head are so severe, it feels like a strong man drilling into my head with a sharp point.

segments.pli: Na me, bhante, khamanīyaṃ na yāpanīyaṃ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṃ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.
segments.en: I’m not keeping well.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, balavā puriso daḷhena varattakkhaṇḍena sīsaveṭhanaṃ dadeyya; evamevaṃ kho me, bhante, adhimattā sīse sīsavedanā.
segments.en: The pain in my head is so severe, it feels like a strong man tightening a tough leather strap around my head.

segments.pli: Na me, bhante, khamanīyaṃ na yāpanīyaṃ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṃ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.
segments.en: I’m not keeping well.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, dakkho goghātako vā goghātakantevāsī vā tiṇhena govikantanena kucchiṃ parikanteyya; evamevaṃ kho me, bhante, adhimattā vātā kucchiṃ parikantanti.
segments.en: The winds piercing my belly are so severe, it feels like a deft butcher or their apprentice is slicing my belly open with a meat cleaver.

segments.pli: Na me, bhante, khamanīyaṃ na yāpanīyaṃ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṃ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo.
segments.en: I’m not keeping well.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, dve balavanto purisā dubbalataraṃ purisaṃ nānābāhāsu gahetvā aṅgārakāsuyā santāpeyyuṃ samparitāpeyyuṃ; evamevaṃ kho me, bhante, adhimatto kāyasmiṃ ḍāho.
segments.en: The burning in my body is so severe, it feels like two strong men grabbing a weaker man by the arms to burn and scorch him on a pit of glowing coals.

segments.pli: Na me, bhante, khamanīyaṃ na yāpanīyaṃ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṃ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo”ti.
segments.en: I’m not keeping well, I’m not alright. The pain is terrible and growing, not fading; its growing is evident, not its fading.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ phaggunaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
segments.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired Venerable Phagguṇa with a Dhamma talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā phagguno acirapakkantassa bhagavato kālamakāsi.
segments.en: Not long after the Buddha left, Venerable Phagguṇa passed away.

segments.pli: Tamhi cassa samaye maraṇakāle indriyāni vippasīdiṃsu.
segments.en: At the time of his death, his faculties were bright and clear.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

segments.pli: “āyasmā, bhante, phagguno acirapakkantassa bhagavato kālamakāsi.
segments.en: “Sir, soon after the Buddha left, Venerable Phagguṇa died.

segments.pli: Tamhi cassa samaye maraṇakāle indriyāni vippasīdiṃsū”ti.
segments.en: At the time of his death, his faculties were bright and clear.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ hānanda, phaggunassa bhikkhuno indriyāni na vippasīdissanti.
segments.en: “And why shouldn’t his faculties be bright and clear?

segments.pli: Phaggunassa, ānanda, bhikkhuno pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ avimuttaṃ ahosi.
segments.en: The mendicant Phagguṇa’s mind was not freed from the five lower fetters.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ dhammadesanaṃ sutvā pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ vimuttaṃ.
segments.en: But when he heard that teaching his mind was freed from them.

segments.pli: Chayime, ānanda, ānisaṃsā kālena dhammassavane kālena atthupaparikkhāya.
segments.en: Ānanda, there are these six benefits to hearing the teaching at the right time and examining the meaning at the right time.

segments.pli: Katame cha?
segments.en: What six?

segments.pli: Idhānanda, bhikkhuno pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ avimuttaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Firstly, take the case of a mendicant whose mind is not freed from the five lower fetters.

segments.pli: So tamhi samaye maraṇakāle labhati tathāgataṃ dassanāya.
segments.en: At the time of death they get to see the Realized One.

segments.pli: Tassa tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.
segments.en: The Realized One teaches them Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ dhammadesanaṃ sutvā pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ vimuccati.
segments.en: When they hear that teaching their mind is freed from the five lower fetters.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, paṭhamo ānisaṃso kālena dhammassavane. (1)
segments.en: This is the first benefit of listening to the teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, bhikkhuno pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ avimuttaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Next, take the case of another mendicant whose mind is not freed from the five lower fetters.

segments.pli: So tamhi samaye maraṇakāle na heva kho labhati tathāgataṃ dassanāya, api ca kho tathāgatasāvakaṃ labhati dassanāya.
segments.en: At the time of death they don’t get to see the Realized One, but they get to see a Realized One’s disciple.

segments.pli: Tassa tathāgatasāvako dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.
segments.en: The Realized One’s disciple teaches them Dhamma …

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ dhammadesanaṃ sutvā pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ vimuccati.
segments.en: When they hear that teaching their mind is freed from the five lower fetters.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, dutiyo ānisaṃso kālena dhammassavane. (2)
segments.en: This is the second benefit of listening to the teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, bhikkhuno pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ avimuttaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Next, take the case of another mendicant whose mind is not freed from the five lower fetters.

segments.pli: So tamhi samaye maraṇakāle na heva kho labhati tathāgataṃ dassanāya, napi tathāgatasāvakaṃ labhati dassanāya;
segments.en: At the time of death they don’t get to see the Realized One, or to see a Realized One’s disciple.

segments.pli: api ca kho yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati.
segments.en: But they think about and consider the teaching in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Tassa yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ cetasā anuvitakkayato anuvicārayato manasānupekkhato pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ vimuccati.
segments.en: As they do so their mind is freed from the five lower fetters.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, tatiyo ānisaṃso kālena atthupaparikkhāya. (3)
segments.en: This is the third benefit of listening to the teaching.

segments.pli: Idhānanda, bhikkhuno pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ vimuttaṃ hoti, anuttare ca kho upadhisaṅkhaye cittaṃ avimuttaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Next, take the case of a mendicant whose mind is freed from the five lower fetters, but not with the supreme ending of attachments.

segments.pli: So tamhi samaye maraṇakāle labhati tathāgataṃ dassanāya.
segments.en: At the time of death they get to see the Realized One.

segments.pli: Tassa tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ … pe … brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.
segments.en: The Realized One teaches them Dhamma …

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ dhammadesanaṃ sutvā anuttare upadhisaṅkhaye cittaṃ vimuccati.
segments.en: When they hear that teaching their mind is freed with the supreme ending of attachments.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, catuttho ānisaṃso kālena dhammassavane. (4)
segments.en: This is the fourth benefit of listening to the teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, bhikkhuno pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ vimuttaṃ hoti, anuttare ca kho upadhisaṅkhaye cittaṃ avimuttaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Next, take the case of another mendicant whose mind is freed from the five lower fetters, but not with the supreme ending of attachments.

segments.pli: So tamhi samaye maraṇakāle na heva kho labhati tathāgataṃ dassanāya, api ca kho tathāgatasāvakaṃ labhati dassanāya.
segments.en: At the time of death they don’t get to see the Realized One, but they get to see a Realized One’s disciple.

segments.pli: Tassa tathāgatasāvako dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ … pe … parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.
segments.en: The Realized One’s disciple teaches them Dhamma …

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ dhammadesanaṃ sutvā anuttare upadhisaṅkhaye cittaṃ vimuccati.
segments.en: When they hear that teaching their mind is freed with the supreme ending of attachments.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, pañcamo ānisaṃso kālena dhammassavane. (5)
segments.en: This is the fifth benefit of listening to the teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, ānanda, bhikkhuno pañcahi orambhāgiyehi saṃyojanehi cittaṃ vimuttaṃ hoti, anuttare ca kho upadhisaṅkhaye cittaṃ avimuttaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Next, take the case of another mendicant whose mind is freed from the five lower fetters, but not with the supreme ending of attachments.

segments.pli: So tamhi samaye maraṇakāle na heva kho labhati tathāgataṃ dassanāya, napi tathāgatasāvakaṃ labhati dassanāya;
segments.en: At the time of death they don’t get to see the Realized One, or to see a Realized One’s disciple.

segments.pli: api ca kho yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati.
segments.en: But they think about and consider the teaching in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Tassa yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ cetasā anuvitakkayato anuvicārayato manasānupekkhato anuttare upadhisaṅkhaye cittaṃ vimuccati.
segments.en: As they do so their mind is freed with the supreme ending of attachments.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, ānanda, chaṭṭho ānisaṃso kālena atthupaparikkhāya. (6)
segments.en: This is the sixth benefit of listening to the teaching.

segments.pli: Ime kho, ānanda, cha ānisaṃsā kālena dhammassavane kālena atthupaparikkhāyā”ti.
segments.en: These are the six benefits to hearing the teaching at the right time and examining the meaning at the right time.”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.

sections.title: Now at that time Venerable Phagguṇa was sick, suffering,…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha consoles Venerable Phagguṇa on his deathbed, and he dies at peace. The Buddha then explains to Ānanda the benefits of hearing the Dhamma at the right time.
